title: 80s favourite to play Hampshire gig tomorrow
text:
SHE'S the iconic flame haired singer behind 80s anthem China In Your Hand. 
Carol Decker brings T'Pau to The Brook tomorrow. 
The band burst onto the music scene in 1987 with the hit Heart & Soul reaching number four in both the UK and US charts. Taken from the debut album Bridge of Spies, its innovative use of a rap verse by a white female vocalist introduced the world to the distinctive lead vocals of Decker. 
Heart & Soul led to a meteoric rise in T'Pau's fortunes both at home & in the USA, where the track stayed on the US billboard chart for six months. After a UK arena tour supporting Bryan Adams, the band immediately toured UK City Halls as headliners to tie in with the next single, the classic ballad China In Your Hand, which stayed at number one for five weeks - the longest serving No. 1 of the year! 
To date, China In Your Hand has appeared on more than 150 compilations, and has become one of the most played songs of the 1980's. 
The original line up of T'Pau split in 1991, but by 1997 Carol had taken the decision to build a new T'Pau. Share article 
Carol has since toured the world, appeared on the West End stage and on TV and played a packed out Big Top tent at Isle of Wight Festival 2013. 
Tickets: the-brook.com or 023 8055 5366. Promoted Stories 80s favourite to play Hampshire gig tomorrow
